artist: Artist: Charles Amand-Durand; Artist: After Claude Gellée (called Le Lorrain)
classification: Printing Matrices; Tools, Equipment and Utilitarian Objects
creditline: Gift of C. G. Boerner in honor of Rachel McGarry
description: copper plate engraved with coastal scene with ships in middle ground in choppy water; small boat with three figures inside and another on shore, LLC; barrels on shore
inscription:
Inscription

LRC, incised backward (parts illegible): [CIAO IELLE-I-V-F-ROMA-7630]
provenance:
Charles Amand-Durand (French, 1831-1905); Georges Rapilly, by the early 20th century; George Rapilly & son (1935); D. Vincent & Co., by the 1950s; with a Dutch publisher, about 1980. [C.G. Boerner, New York, 2010; given to MIA]

This provenance is speculative and is based on the general history of the plates given in the 2010 on-line edition of Frits Lugt, Marques des collections (http://www.marquesdecollections.fr/detail.cfm/marque/10269/total/1):
title: Printing plate for "The Tempest (Le Tempête)"
